perturbation.original_text: This NON-COMPETITION AGREEMENT AMENDMENT NO. 1 (this "Amendment") is entered into as of August 16, 2017, by and between VIVINT SOLAR, INC., a Delaware corporation (together with its successors and permitted assigns, "Vivint Solar"), and VIVINT, INC., a Utah corporation (together with its successors and permitted assigns "Vivint"). Each of Vivint Solar and Vivint may also be referred to herein individually as a "Party", and collectively as the "Parties".
perturbation.changed_text: This NON-COMPETITION AGREEMENT AMENDMENT NO. 1 (this "Amendment") is entered into as of August 16, 2017, by and between VIVINT SOLAR, INC., a Delaware corporation (together with its successors and permitted assigns, "Vivint Solar"), and VIVINT, INC., a Utah corporation (together with its successors and permitted assigns "Vivint"). Each of Vivint Solar and Vivint may also be referred to herein individually as a "Party", and collectively as the "Entities".
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Parties' is replaced with 'Entities' in the collective reference, creating uncertainty about whether 'Party' refers to the same grouping or distinct units. This makes it unclear if obligations applicable to 'Parties' apply to the same group now referred to as 'Entities'.

perturbation.original_text:
3. Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:

"Term. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date, and will continue until the expiration of the "Sales Term" as that term is defined in the Sales Dealer Agreement dated as of August 16, 2017 between Vivint and Vivint Solar Developer, LLC (the "Term")."
perturbation.changed_text:
3. Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:

"Duration. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date, and will continue until the expiration of the "Sales Term" as that term is defined in the Sales Dealer Agreement dated as of August 16, 2017 between Vivint and Vivint Solar Developer, LLC (the "Term")."
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Term" to "Duration" when referencing the length of the agreement, while still using "Term" in the quoted section referring to the Sales Dealer Agreement introduces confusion. It's now unclear if 'Term' refers to the duration of the agreement or the specific 'Sales Term' as defined elsewhere, impacting enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Master Framework Agreement. This Amendment is governed by the Master Framework Agreement, including, without limitation, the provisions of Sections 4 (Confidentiality) and 6 (Miscellaneous) of the Master Framework Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Governing Law. This Amendment is governed by the Master Framework Agreement, including, without limitation, the provisions of Sections 4 (Confidentiality) and 6 (Miscellaneous) of the Master Framework Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing “Master Framework Agreement” with “Governing Law” changes the entire focus of Section 5. In the original text, the framework agreement governs the terms of the current agreement. Replacing Master Framework Agreement by governing law makes the reader uncertain what laws govern the current agreement. This creates a contradiction between this clause and potentially other jurisdiction clauses elsewhere (if there are any).
